--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Umer Iqbal" <umeriqbal81@h...> wrote:

> I've got a huge MS Word document on the project. I'll try to upload
it somewhere and share it with the rest of you. 
> But no promises! The internet back here is extremely slow :(
> 

Hi Umer, if you do decide to upload it, you may consider uploading it
to the files section of this group.  

> 
> Thanks :), I'd need loads of it. 
> Yes, I will apply to the US. Haven't finalized any universities as
yet. 
> 
> You recommended UCSD, could you guys suggest more places where
similar work is going on? 
> I know, UT Austin is one :)
>

Jordan Pollack's group at Brandeis also does the kind of work you're
interested in : http://www.demo.cs.brandeis.edu/

Finding good places to study neuroevoltuion in the US is a real
problem.  Joseph Reisinger, who is in this group and also looking for
grad schools, may have some other suggestions.  But outside UT Austin
there aren't a lot of places with big neuroevolution research groups.
 
The UK has a few schools.  In the US, you should probably apply to
schools that are ranked well in AI, but also maybe talk to professors
after getting in somewhere to make sure they are interested in
neuroevolution.

ken
